content.description: Fun lowball lip traverse.  Start in a little pocket on the lip and a nice right jug right.  Move along the lip to the left until you hit the juggy arête, and mantle
content.protection: A pad or two.  Spotter wouldn't be bad if you don't want the risk of rolling down the hill
content.location: Just past the first mini roof and just before the second.

content.description: Sit start on the right side of the boulder. Traverse left and finish with a mantle.
content.location: To the right of the Stella Artois Boulder.

content.description: Texas County mega classic - Stand Start with left hand on arete and right hand on a crimp - Climb straight up.
Space between left arete and right dihedral
Located downhill from Size Matters - Start on right arete with left crimp and continue out left on slopers and top out. Area classic.
Sit start on the jug ledge. Use left hand slot jugs and right hand sloppy jugs until the top.
content.location: To the left of The Stuff Of Dreams Boulder.

content.description: Slap and Squeeze on opposing slopers and top out at the point.
Sit start on jug. Climb straight up using a variety of pockets, side pulls and sloppers. Top out is crux.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders.

content.description: Sit start, right hand pinch and left hand side pull. Climb straight up the massive ship like arete. Crux is at the top. Wouldn’t be a bad idea to try it on a rope first.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the slight drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach the large ship like boulder.

content.description: Start on juggy sloper rails.  Move right over to fairly nice edge. then up to kind of sloping, half pad crimp. adjust feet, and hit the nice jug up and left.  Another jug above that one, then top out.  There are a couple jugs left for the top out, or you can go directly up/out right and do a hard mantle and add a grade or so.  Not totally sure about the grade, but seems about right
content.protection: Couple pads.  Spotter would be nice for the top out to make sure you don't roll off the drop off behind it.
content.location: Just past Humanly Animals at the beginning of the main mini roof

content.description: Really fun problem.  Start on the shelf.  Dabby first move out to a nice right finger bucket.  Throw a heel up and make a couple moves out left to crimps.  Make a couple moves with the left hand out to the left, bring in the right hand, and continue moving through the crimps.  Get a nice foot jam in the crack, cross up with the left, then move out into jugs for the topout.  Fun mantle with good holds, but easy to get stuck under the roof.  Definitely not sure about the grade.  I'll probably agree with whatever others suggest.  I've felt like it's three or four different grades throughout the process.
content.location: About halfway through the mini roof.

content.description: Same start as Lonely Boy. After the Undercling trend right until top out.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders.

content.description: Start matched on a jug rail under the roof. Climb straight up until you reach the overhung section. Small holds and hard body tension leads to a huge cut feet swing. After catching the swing throw big for a left hand pinch. Then right hand crimp just below the lip. Next cross left hand into a jug pocket, then fight your way to the top.
content.location: Once parked, Hike southwest into the woods for 560 feet. Towards a slight drainage. As you travel downhill, follow the cliff line on your right hand side. Keep following the cliff line until you reach a huge roof.

content.description: Start in middle of the slab. Climb straight up through the faceOne of the best pure slabs anywhere. Could hold its own next to other world class slab boulders. A must climb!!
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders then head across the valley until you will come across the obvious slab. Longer but easier to follow approach would be to follow the line of rock all the way around the drainage.Pin:  37°28'47"N 92°00'17"W

content.description: Sit start on jug. Climb straight up using left side pull and a crimp in the middle of the face.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders

content.description: Thin Arete

Start on any of the three crimps under the mini roof, nice heel on the remaining ledge on the right.  Move up and left.  You could definitely start from the remaining ledge, but it's dabby and annoying.  Was a lot more fun before the ledge in between the crimps and what remains was still there.
content.location: Short hike past the main cluster of boulders.  Just before the main mini roof section.

content.description: If you prefer not doing a scary mantle 15ft off the ground. Then this is the version for you. Same climb as Horny Mantle Direct besides top out.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders.

content.description: Warning Beta Spray: Sit start with good feet. Left hand in a 3 finger pocket & right hand on a polished crimp. Left hand to a pinch, then right hand to a sharp horn like jug. Move the feet then cross right hand to a pinch. Left hand directly above the pinch to a small jug. Get a left heel then left hand to a side pull jug. Right hand to a nice side pull edge. Then move your left to another side pull jug. Right hand moves to a pinch, then left hand cross into a deep pocket. Cross your right into a slot crimp then left to a jug at the lip. Scary high mantle.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders.

content.description: Sit start on two crimps with a right heel. Sweet compression problem.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders.

content.description: Sit start on Jug. Easy climbing up rounded arete.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach a section of large boulders.

content.description: Sit start, right hand side pull and left hand side pull. Sweet crimp compression problem. Same top out as shipwreck.
content.location: When entering jacktar follow the slight drainage then trend right along the hillside until you reach the large ship like boulder.

content.description: Check out Southwest Missouri Bouldering by Justin Frese - now available climbsource.com/products/so… - Covering over 600 problems and 20 plus areas - it provides detailed instructions for Paddy Creek and more in Mark Twain National Forest.
